accounts.name: Checking Account
accounts.description: Used for daily transactions, including deposits, withdrawals, and payments. Usually has no or low interest.

accounts.name: Savings Account
accounts.description: Designed for saving money with interest. Limited withdrawals may apply.

accounts.name: Emergency Fund Account
accounts.description: Set aside funds for unexpected expenses, often separate from main savings to avoid accidental spending.

accounts.name: Health Savings Account (HSA)
accounts.description: Used for health-related expenses, often with tax benefits, provided you have a high-deductible health plan.

accounts.name: Investment Account
accounts.description: For holding and managing investments like stocks, bonds, mutual funds, or ETFs.

accounts.name: Retirement Account
accounts.description: Long-term savings specifically for retirement, like a 401(k) or IRA. May have tax benefits and withdrawal restrictions.

accounts.name: Cash Management Account (CMA)
accounts.description: A hybrid of checking and investment accounts, commonly offered by brokerage firms, allowing easy transfer between cash and investments.

accounts.name: Brokerage Account
accounts.description: Used for trading securities like stocks, bonds, and mutual funds.

accounts.name: Education Savings Account (ESA)
accounts.description: For educational expenses, like a 529 plan, with tax benefits for qualifying expenses.

accounts.name: Credit Card Account
accounts.description: Represents a line of credit used for purchases, with a set limit and interest on unpaid balances.

accounts.name: Loan Account
accounts.description: Tracks a loan (e.g., personal, auto, mortgage) with regular payments toward principal and interest.
